intro: Pulmonaria anuua, commonly known as the spring pulmonaria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in early spring, producing pink or purple flowers that attract pollinators. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, white down, giving them a silvery appearance. Pulmonaria anuua thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady garden settings.
